intro: Anthoxanthum odoratum f. glabrum, commonly known as sweet vernalgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and bright yellow to orange inflorescences that appear in early spring. The variety f. glabrum is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves and stems, setting it apart from other forms of the species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and disturbed areas. This plant is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential use in ornamental gardening.
